etymology.interpretation: The character 身(身) (shēn, "body") visually represents a pregnant woman, symbolizing the human body. It is a straightforward depiction that emphasizes the physical aspect of the human form. A related character, 㐆, represents a reversed version of 身(身), though they are separate in meaning.

examples.chinese: 他身轻如燕(他身輕如燕)。
examples.english: He is as light as a swallow.

examples.chinese: 他每天跑步以强身健体(他每天跑步以強身健體)，充满活力地迎接每一天(充滿活力地迎接每一天)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān pǎobù yǐ qiáng shēn jiàn tǐ, chōng mǎn huólì de yíngjiē měi yītiān.
examples.english: He runs every day to strengthen his body, and welcomes each day full of vitality.

examples.chinese: 身在福中不知福(身在福中不知福)。
examples.pinyin: Shēn zài fú zhōng bù zhī fú.
examples.english: One does not appreciate the blessing of being in good fortune.
